Connected Learning Programming

CC-BY-SA by ConnectedLib

90 minutes

Module Overview

In this module, Connected Learning Programming, you will learn how connected learning fits in with a 21st century library. This module provides an overview of the program design process and offers some springboards to help inspire your next teen initiative.

Learning Objectives For This Module

After completing the Connected Learning Programs module, you will be able to…

  • Explain how connected learning can help you create a 21st century library (Section 1: Introduction).
  • Describe the process of creating a connected learning library program (Section 2: Program Design).
  • Understand the diversity of connected learning program elements (Section 3: A Connected Learning Playbook.)

Section 1 discusses the 21st century library and how connected learning fits in with one. Section 2 provides a high-level look at the process of developing a program, and Section 3 describes the variety of elements that can make up connected learning programs.

Learning aid: Programming KWL

Complete this worksheet by first describing your experience (if any) with creating programs for teens (include your experience with connected learning programs if you have any). Then create a list of what you already know (the K in KWL) about creating connected learning programs. In the second column, write down what you want (W) to learn in this module. You’ll fill out the last column, what you learned (L), when you have completed this module.

Download worksheet (DOCX)

  • What do you already know about connected learning programming?
  • What do you want to learn about connected learning programming?
  • What did you learn from this module about connected learning programming? (You will answer this question at the end of the module.)

How to Use This Module

This module is made up of sections, which can be accessed from the drop-down menu at the top of the page.

(image of drop-down menu)

Each section is divided into subsections, which are listed in the menu on the left side of the page.

(image of lefthand nav)

  • Each section has learning outcomes which are displayed in blue like this.
Case studies and examples look like this.
Explanatory videos or additional materials look like this.
Tips and pointers from librarians and elsewhere look like this.
Reflections and exercises to help you apply the module’s concepts to your individual context look like this.

At the end of each section, there are additional resources for you to explore further on your own if you choose. Ready to get started? Let’s begin with Section 1: The 21st Century Library.
